text:
ESTHER HSU WANG: So
I get up every day

because I want to make
the world a better place.

I want to make sure
the work I'm doing

is translated even if it's
a few steps away to a better
life for someone.

IDinsight advises leaders
in the development sector
on how to improve their impact.

So we're trying to get on
the inside of the decisions,

understand exactly
what decisions

need to be made, what
evidence is needed,

and help the decision
makers and the leaders

of countries or big
programs understand
which direction to take things.

We send in teams that bring
out quantitative insights

from the best data that we
can get from the ground,

from the client,
from [INAUDIBLE]..

We're tackling these challenges,
like hunger sanitation, water,

agriculture, in Africa, in Asia,
and about a dozen countries
around the world.

And then I also handle
a lot of the people

side of growing IDinsight, and
every person is also different.

It takes a lot of
endurance and perseverance,

which is driven by heart, to
know why you're doing something

and why it makes sense
to keep going forward.

There's so much talent
collected and pulling

in the same direction that
it feels like we absolutely
will have to make an impact.

The difference I hope to make is
that at the end of my IDinsight

chapter, we really
have changed the way

the world tries to support
those who are in most need,

whether that's a new system,
a new way of thinking things,
new measurements.

There have to be
lives that are better

because IDinsight existed and
because I was working there.
